name: annex
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to take possession of an area of land or a country, usually by force or without permission: The UK annexed this small island west of Scotland in 1955.

annex verb [T]
(TAKE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to take possession of an area of land or a country and add it to a larger area, usually by force: The United States annexed parts of Texas and New Mexico, which belonged to Mexico. annexation noun [ C/U ] us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/ˌæn·ekˈseɪ·ʃən, ˌæn·ək-/
[ U ] the annexation of Latvia by the Soviet Union
annex noun [C]
(ADDED BUILDING)
an addition to a building, or another building, used with an existing building: The old warehouse became an annex of the main store.
Add to word list
Add to word list
an addition to a document or report: The List of Export Subsidies is provided in Annex I to the Agreement.
